respective directors, officers, employees and agents, successors and assigns, from and against any and all claims, demands, losses, liabilities,

perturbation.changed_text:
Affiliate agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Chase, its shareholders, officers, directors, employees, agents, affiliates and their
respective directors, officers, employees and agents, successors and assigns, from and against any and all claims, demands, losses, liabilities,
damages or expenses (including attorneys’ fees and costs) of any nature whatsoever incurred or suffered by Chase (collectively the “losses”), in so
far as such losses (or actions in respect thereof) arise out of, are related to, or are based on (i) the breach of any representation, warranty, or
covenant made by Affiliate herein, except for gross negligence or (ii) any claim related to Affiliate’s site.
perturbation.explanation: This alteration introduces a caveat to the affiliate's indemnification obligations, specifically excluding gross negligence. This contradicts the standard principle that parties can't be indemnified for their own gross negligence or willful misconduct, especially in jurisdictions that disallow such broad indemnification agreements. The added phrase attempts to narrow the scope but creates ambiguity and potential unenforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law principles, particularly those regarding indemnification and liability limitations. Some jurisdictions have specific statutes or case law disallowing indemnification for gross negligence or willful misconduct.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement will be governed in all respects by the laws of the State of Delaware, including its conflict with law provisions.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement will be governed in all respects by the laws of the State of Delaware, except in cases of intellectual property which will be governed by federal law, including its conflict with law provisions.
perturbation.explanation: The clause now indicates that while Delaware law generally governs the agreement, intellectual property matters will be subject to federal law. Intellectual property is a specialized area with its own set of rules, and conflicts often arise between state contract law and federal IP law. By carving out intellectual property, the clause introduces a dual-governance structure which can lead to confusion and potential conflicts of law issues if not clearly delineated.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Conflict of Laws principles, specifically regarding the application of state vs. federal law. Intellectual property law is primarily federal, but contracts related to intellectual property often fall under state jurisdiction.
